snippet: A bill to provide federal aid to states pummeled by Hurricane Sandy was in danger of dying on Tuesday night as the House seemed headed for adjournment without taking up the legislation.
abstract: Bill to provide $60.4 billion in federal aid to states pummeled by Hurricane Sandy remains in danger as House prepares to adjourn without voting on package; measure will have to be reintroduced in the new Congress if last-minute action is not taken.
lead_paragraph: A bill to provide federal aid to states pummeled by Hurricane Sandy was in danger of dying on Tuesday night as the House seemed headed for adjournment without taking up the legislation.

headline.seo: Billions in Aid for Hurricane Sandy Victims in Danger of Stalling
headline.main: Billions in Aid for Hurricane Victims Appears in Jeopardy
headline.print_headline: Bill for Hurricane Aid Appears in Jeopardy
